'''U-lite Linux''' (originally Ubuntulite) is an [[operating system]] that features [[LXDE]] and lightweight programs based on [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], but it is not an official project by [[Canonical Ltd.]] The goal of U-lite Linux is to create a [[Linux distribution|distribution]] based on [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] that is reasonably fast even on limited [[hardware]]. In contrast to other variants of [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], U-lite Linux is focused on providing a trimmed set of [[software]] packages while providing the experience expected by a modern computer user. Furthermore, the user interface is designed to be usable even at smaller resolutions such as those on older computers and netbooks.
U-lite Linux uses software from the repositories of [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] but also includes some more up-to-date packages than those in the repositories to provide bugfixes and features for key programs, such as [[LXDE]], the default desktop environment used in U-lite. U-lite Linux is promoted, developed and distributed by the U-lite Linux Project, with donations by thankful users and sponsors finance.
The ulite.org web page displays this message 'This domain name expired on 10/16/2011 and is pending renewal or deletion'.
== Main characteristics == * U-lite Linux focuses on features, speed and efficiency when selecting the default programs to accomplish the most common tasks computer users do. Thus, U-lite can run on computers that cannot run [[GNOME]], [[Plasma Workspaces]] or [[Xfce]] well. * U-lite Linux makes use of the familiar [[Firefox]] and [[Mozilla Thunderbird|Thunderbird]] as the web browsing and email client respectively. However, users can easily replace most applications with their favorites without breaking updates. * U-lite Linux is ready for common office tasks because it includes [[Abiword]] for word processing tasks and [[Gnumeric]] for spreadsheets.
== Trademark issues == On September 10, 2008 Canonical emailed the Ubuntulite developers complaining the project's use of Canonical's names, URLs and logos violates Canonical's trademarks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ulite.org/node/171 |title=A message from Canonical: Change your name |publisher=ulite.org}}</ref> After multiple surveys, the name U-lite was chosen on November 6, 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ulite.org/node/209 |title=And the winner is . . .|publisher=u-lite.org}}</ref>
